reviewText: Very well done Nature Series.  The voice-over & story lines fit well with what was shot...
Filiming was stupendas. Less naration and more up close shots would have been good. A mention of Diane Fossey and her fate would have been nice
I work at the zoo with the Apes.  I am always looking for something on DVD or in book form to donate for our silent auction every year.
THIS DOCUMENTARY IS SIMPLY FANTASTIC. WONDERFUL STORY LINE, WONDERFUL PHOTOGRAPHY. A MUST FOR EVERYONE TO SEE, NOT JUST NATURE LOVERS.

I liked that they studied the Gorillas closely and found that they do many things just like humans. The study of particular families of Gorillas led by the big Silverback was exciting. But, very heartbreating when the government allowed poaching again bringing the numbers of Gorillas to the brink of extinction. So many orphans, that cannot live without their mothers, as the mothers care completely for the babies for about four-five years. Mothers were shot while holding their babies, traumatizing them. It showed man in the worse and best of light. There were people finding the wounded and orphand babies bringing to shelters to be cared for 24 hours a day. Dedicated people who give their lives to protect the Gorillas. I have a great love and respect for all wild life but, mostly the Gorilas. They are very intelligent animals and are being slaughtered for trophies. I'm glad I purchased the DVD and the book. I will continue to advocate surival of this great, majestic creature. This is a must see video for the lover of the animals of Africa. Mountain Gorilla (IMAX)In the Kingdom of Gorillas: Fragile Species in a Dangerous Land

This documentary covers the life of the most studied Mountain Gorilla in history, Titus. Titus's life has not however always been one of standard Gorilla behaviour. From his unexpected birth, through his survival of the death of his father, then his non violent takeover of his family group and the subsequent years as it grew to be the largest known Group in the Virungas. The documentary team arrive just in time for Titus loss of control of his group, again in a non normal manner.

The doco features some great footage of Titus right through his life. This is backed with a clear factual voiceover and commentary from various researchers who have studied Titus and his groups over the years.

If you are at all into Gorillas you will love this DVD.
If you like silverback gorillas you will enjoy this DVD. Excellent story and footage of these amazing creatures....
